Functions

util_queue_sync_query
[Queue References]

Functions

void * util_queue_sync_query (handle_t section, util_queue_t *queue)

Function Documentation

void* util_queue_sync_query ( handle_t  section,
util_queue_t *  queue 
)

The util_queue_sync_query routine can be used by an application to query synchronously for a previously inserted object (util_queue_sync_insert). Checking the queue for an object is blocked for other processes or threads at this time. If the queue contains at least one object, the object will be removed from the queue list and returned by leaving this routine.

NOTE: The routine returns always the first object inserted in the queue.

Parameters:
section references critical section (see OSAL documentation).
queue Specifies the queue resource.
Returns:
A reference to an object indicates success. NULL indicates an empty queue.
See also:
util_queue_sync_insert
